title: Can't screenshot a specific tweet
content: For some reason when I try to download a screenshot of [this tweet] it fails every time; I tested it and it's just that tweet specifically. This has never happened before and I assume it's just a bug since copy-pasting still works. Any help with this?
creator: mrjuls00

title: How to force http instead of https
content:
I have tried most of those: https://superuser.com/questions/1721511/firefox-allow-http-urls-and-not-force-https

Nothing seems to work and Firefox121 always resorts to https when attempting to reach the website, I verified with other browsers and http works fine.

Which other steps can be taken to try and finally get firefox121 to use http instead of https. Thanks.
creator: remiloup.oriol

title: Changing url in the same tab
content: Hello, currently using 120.0.1 (64-bit) for macos and would like to know how to change behavior: When i'm trying to modify url in tab i'm currently working on and press enter/return it opens modified url in new tab for some reason. But when i hold option it opens it in current tab, is there any way to make it as default behavior? Thank you very muchüëç
creator: hevzy86

title: How do I detect FireFox Pop-Up blocker in code and notify visitors that they need to disable the FireFox pop-up blocker to enable Search to function with the ENTER KEY and not only the magnifying Glass Icon?
content:
Hi,

ONLY FireFox blocks using the ENTER key to launch a SEARCH on my website - (which is strangely allowed by FF IF I manually disable pop-up blocking)!

So, then how do I detect FireFox Pop-Up blocker in code on my website pages that include searches (just for FF visitors) and notify those visitors using FF that they need to disable the FireFox pop-up blocker to enable Search to function with the ENTER KEY and not only the magnifying Glass Icon (without using a pop-up notification - which will obviously be blocked by the FF pop-up blocker), please?

Sounds like mission impossible - for a "pop-up block" of what actually is NOT a pop-up (while every other browser happily allows search with an ENTER key)?

Or can FF possibly just FIX the pop-up blocking code to allow Search with an ENTER key (like all the other browsers do), PLEASE?
creator: alan.holm
